items.challengeText: *Flooded start: start full lean and throttle full open then reverse when engine starts to fire
Note: all speeds listed here are in knots indicated airspeed (KIAS)

items.responseText: 60-65 (MIN ON SHORT FINAL; ADD FOR CONDITIONS)

items.challengeText: BEST PLACE TO LAND - CHOOSE ONE EFFICIENTLY CONSIDERING SURFACE, WIND, AND OBSTACLES, THEN FLY TO IT

items.responseText: TRY L & R (AND START IF PROP NOT WINDMILLING)

items.challengeText: Continue to next appropriate checklist if no restart
BEST PLACE TO LAND - CHOOSE ANYTHING
Unless engine starts, then run it at 1700 RPM for a few seconds
LANDING AREA - AVOID WATER; CONSIDER BEACH OR TREES, IF UNABLE:
High winds and swells: land into the wind
Light wind: land parallel to swells

items.responseText: PREPARED (DO NOT INFLATE UNTIL AFTER EXITING)

items.challengeText: AFTER TOUCHDOWN: EVACUATE AIRCRAFT; MAY NEED TO OPEN WINDOWS FIRST TO HELP EQUALIZE WATER PRESSURE
BEST PLACE TO LAND - CHOOSE ONE EFFICIENTLY CONSIDERING SURFACE, WIND, AND OBSTACLES, THEN FLY TO IT
Secure Engine (when landing assured, if off-airport)
TURN OR CLIMB TO EXIT EITHER BELOW FREEZING TEMPERATURES OR MOISTURE

items.responseText: ON, ADJUST FOR MAX WINDSHIELD DEFROST
FULL OPEN FOR MAX RPM TO MINIMIZE ICE ON PROP
ON WHEN ENGINE BEGINS LOSING POWER
LEAN APPROPRIATELY IF USING CONTINUOUS CARB HEAT

items.challengeText: PREPARE TO LAND AT NEAREST AIRPORT OR, IF ICE ACCUMULATION IS RAPID, OFF-AIRPORT
AIRSPEED - INCREASE APPROPRIATELY SINCE ICE INCREASES STALL SPEED

items.responseText: APPROACH AND LAND AT 65-75 OR MORE AS NEEDED
DO NOT USE (COULD CAUSE TAIL STALL)

items.challengeText: OPEN WINDOW AND SCRAPE WINDSHIELD AS NEEDED

items.responseText: ON (AFTER A FEW SECONDS OF WAITING)

items.challengeText: LAND AS SOON AS PRACTICAL, BE PREPARED FOR NO-FLAP LANDING IF BATTERY DIES

items.responseText: ON (OR BREAK VSI GLASS IF INOP/NOT INSTALLED)

items.challengeText: AIRSPEED - CONSULT POH FOR CALIBRATION TABLES (IF NONE, ASSUME AIRSPEED READS A FEW KNOTS SLOW)
ALTITUDE - READS HIGHER THAN ACTUAL, ADD A SAFETY MARGIN TO APPROACH MINIMUMS
NAVIGATE TO THE LONGEST AVAILABLE RUNWAY WITHIN ~20 MINUTES OR SO
MIXTURE - PULL SLOWLY UNTIL IT BEGINS TO REDUCE RPM, EXPERIMENT TO BECOME FAMILIAR WITH THIS NARROW RANGE WHERE MIXTURE CONTROLS RPM
COMPLETE A NORMAL APPROACH AND LANDING USING CAREFUL MIXTURE TO CONTROL RPM. DO NOT KILL ENGINE UNTIL LANDING IS ASSURED AND ALL OTHER OPTIONS HAVE BEEN EXHAUSTED
TOUCHDOWN: LAND ON MAINS AND HOLD WEIGHT OFF NOSE ALMOST AS LONG AS POSSIBLE WITH ELEVATOR
GENTLY LOWER NOSE ONTO THE RUNWAY AND CUSHION IMPACT WITH REMAINING BACK ELEVATOR BEFORE THE FULL NOSE UP STOP IS ENCOUNTERED
CHOOSE A RUNWAY WITH ZERO CROSSWIND OR FROM THE SIDE WITH A GOOD TIRE
TOUCHDOWN: LAND ON GOOD MAIN AND HOLD WEIGHT OFF BAD SIDE AS LONG AS POSSIBLE WITH AILERONS
APPLY RUDDER AND ASYMMETRIC BRAKING AS NECESSARY TO MAINTAIN CENTERLINE

items.responseText: RETRACT TO 20-30Â° IMMEDIATELY, THEN SLOWLY ONCE POSITIVE RATE
